metadata.title: CVE-2017-11102 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The ReadOneJNGImage function in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) during JNG reading via a zero-length color_image data structure. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-11102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-2
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-2
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-2
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-2
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-2
No subscription required

notes.note: ebarretto> Watch out when applying the fix, it introduces a new vuln. See CVE-2017-11139

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-2').
